title: DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY
author: Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 1

elements.text: PART ONE
PRE-CREDITS: REPRISE FROM THE ANGEL OF SCUTARI PART FOUR
FX: FADE UP. FROM SCENES 35/40:
I say the boy’s a collaborator. To hell with him.
Bartholomew, no-!!!
Oh God. Ace —
FX: MUSKET FIRES
CONTINUES INTO REPRISE FROM SCENE 56: INT. CORRIDOR
IS HIT, IN THE SHOULDER. CRIES OUT AND GOES DOWN
CROSSFADE INTO FURTHER REPRISE, ALSO FROM SCENE 56:
(WOUND TOUCHED) God-!
Stay still, Mr Schofield! I can see — the shot has passed through the clavipectoral fascia...
Anything else-?
. I need more light. Mr Russell! Procure me a lamp, if you please!
I don’t believe it. The one time the Lady with the Lamp’s without a lamp, is when she’s treating me —
CROSSFADE INTO FURTHER REPRISE, ALSO FROM SCENE 56:
FX: MATERIALISATION COMPLETE. DOOR OPENS
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 3
Doctor! Ace!
FOLLOWING DOCTOR) Alright face-ache? .. (SEEING HEX’S WOUND
Oh my God, what’s happened?
CROSSFADE INTO REPRISE FROM SCENE 57: INT. TARDIS
Doctor! Wherever we’re going, we need to get there fast-!
Don’t wanna be in any poncey space hospital, mind. There’s only one time and one place I wanna be right now —
I realise that, Mister Hex! And that — is precisely where we’re going!
FX: UP IN-FLIGHT PITCH; TARDIS CHANGES COURSE
Where-?
He knows — (GROANS, PASSES OUT)
Hex? Can you hear me?
. Saint Gart’s.
(FRANTIC) HEX!!!
MUSIC: CRASH INTO OPENING THEME
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 4
SCENE 1: EXT. LONDON STREET (DAY)

(FX: ALL IS QUIET, SAVE FOR THE ODD BIRDSONG. NO PEOPLE. NO TRAFFIC. NOTHING, UNTIL THE TARDIS MATERIALISES. ENGINES FADE TO NOTHING. SILENCE. A DOG BARKS IN THE DISTANCE. THEN, BOTH DOORS SLAM OPEN. RATTLE OF WHEELCHAIR LIFTED OUT OF DOORS)
(SHOVING WHEELCHAIR) Stupid great thing-! Come — on!!!
(GROANS) Whuh-?
Gently, Ace! Wheel him out gently!
We haven’t time!
We must take care! Hex is in a dangerous condition.
(PAINED, WOOZY) Yeah, 19th century musket balls in your shoulder will do that...
Don’t. Say. Anything. Understand?
Don’t worry, Mr Hex — (FX: CLOSING TARDIS DOOR) — the hospital is just around the corner.
Are you sure? This doesn’t look like I remember.
We're in the year 2024... or possibly 2026. The TARDIS hasn’t fully recovered yet. — (SEEING SOMETHING) A-ha!
The Rabbit!
The White Rabbit public house, a stone’s throw from Saint
Gart’s. Some things never change.
Well, what are we waiting for? Come on!
FX: ACE PUSHES THE WHEELCHAIR URGENTLY FORWARD
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 5
GROANS
sorry.
Just... get a shift on, eh?
Brace yourself.
FX: CLATTERING WHEELCHAIR AS THEY RUN
LONG GROAN
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 6
SCENE 2: EXT. LONDON STREET (DAY)
(FX: FADE UP. 3 x BOOTSTEPS ECHO ON SILENT STREET. A TRACKER DEVICE BEEPS REPEATEDLY )
Life signs detected. One Contaminant confirmed in the area.
Sergeant Jarrod, Corporal Matthews, with me.
JARROD/SOLDIER: Ma’am.
Let’s keep it tight, I want no foul-ups this time.
FX: THEY MOVE OFF
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 7
SCENE 3: EXT. LONDON ROAD (DAY)
FX: THE WHEELCHAIR RATTLES AS ACE TEARS ALONG
(RUSHING) Ace, be careful! You’1ll have him over!
(RUSHING) Then you should have dropped us off closer!
(RUSHING) Imagine the fuss if we’d materialised in Reception.
(RUSHING) You alright there, Hex? (BEAT) Hex, can you hear me?
(RUSHING) Mr Hex, stay with us!
(RUSHING) It’s no use — he’s out of it.
(RUSHING) It’s only to be expected. We’re outside the beneficial environment of the TARDIS — (ALARM) Mind the road!
(STOPPED) Yeah, there’s no traffic-?
(STOPPED) Don’t be absurd. We’re in London, of course there’s traffic. —
BEAT. SILENCE
(PUZZLED) No traffic.
It’s the middle of the day. No traffic. No people. Nothing.
(FX: RATTLING WHEELCHAIR) Who cares? We’re here to get Hex patched up, remember?
“Upon this street where time has died.” As if London has just... stopped. But why...?
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 8
SCENE 4: EXT. THAMES EMBANKMENT (DAY)
(FX: FADE UP. WATER LAPPING. 3 x BOOTSTEPS APPROACH AND STOP. TRACKER BEEPS REPEATEDLY )
Jarrod?
I can’t tell, Ma’am. It’s like something just disrupted the Signal, some weird energy discharge nearby in the last few minutes.
Keep trying. (BEAT) Can’t get used to London like this. Two months since the evacuation and still no closer to a breakthrough.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 9
SCENE 5: EXT. ST GART’S CAR PARK (DAY)
FX: FADE UP CLATTER OF WHEELCHAIR, RUSHING FOOTSTEPS
(RUSHING) At last! Accident and Emergency!
(RUSHING) Hear that, Hex? Soon be over —
(SKIDDING TO HALT) Ace, stop!
(FX: BRAKING WHEELCHAIR) What is it?
The doors.
What about them?
They should have opened automatically.
BEAT
No power?
FX: DOCTOR PULLS ON AUTOMATIC DOORS. THEY REMAIN CLOSED
Locked.
What’s going on, Doctor?
FX: IN THE DISTANCE, A CHOPPER
Listen.
FX: CHOPPER COMING CLOSER
A chopper. There are people about.
I suggest we get out of sight.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 10
Maybe they can help.
I think, for now... (FX: BUZZ OF SONIC SCREWDRIVER ON DOORS)
caution is advised.
Hurry up!
FX: LOCK SPARKS AND FIZZES. END SCREWDRIVER
Success! Now — pull!
(FX: TOGETHER THEY HEAVE THE DOORS OPEN. CHOPPER ALMOST ON TOP OF THEM)
After you, Ace.
(FX: THEY PUSH THE WHEELCHAIR INSIDE JUST AS THE CHOPPER FLIES OVERHEAD )
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 11
SCENE 6: INT. CHOPPER (DAY)
FX: CHOPPER ROARS THROUGH THE ATR
Perseus, Pegasus Two.
(DISTORT, THRU SPEAKER) Perseus receiving. Over.
Possible sighting of civilians in Sector One, vicinity of St Gart’s. Over.
SCENE 7: EXT. THAMES EMBANKMENT (DAY)
FX: AS BEFORE. TRACKER STILL BLEEPING
Acknowledged. What’s their status? Over.
(D) Unknown. Over.
Then we’ll investigate. Continue sweep to Sector Three. Perseus out. (FX: CRUNCH OF STATIC AS SHE CLOSES COMMS CHANNEL) Change of plan, boys. Let’s go.
FX: 3 x BOOTSTEPS MOVE OFF. FADE
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 12
SCENE 8: INT. ST. GART’S — RECEPTION
(FX: EXTERIOR DOORS SLID SHUT. INSIDE, ST GART’S IS EMPTY, ECHOEY, DEAD)
Welcome home, Mr Hex.
Do you think the chopper saw us?
I can’t be certain, but we have more important things to worry about. Now, Reception desk —
FX: DOCTOR TAPS AT A KEYBOARD
Weird to be in A and E, without the six-hour wait.
Quite. All human life should be here. Something is very wrong.
What are you doing?
Trying to shed a little light on the situation. (FX: BREAKS OFF TYPING) Only I’m getting nowhere! (BEAT) Perhaps — an appeal to a higher power? (CALLING) System: online. (NOTHING) System?
System’s as dead as this place. We need to get Hex somewhere else if St Gart’s is closed for business.
The whole of London is closed for business, it seems.
(DECIDING) If the System network is down, we’ll have to do this the old-fashioned way.
FX: ANOTHER WHINE OF THE SONIC
Come on, Doctor.
Just a little rerouting, and...
FX: FLUORESCENT LIGHTS FLICKER AND BUZZ INTO LIFE OVERHEAD
Emergency power?
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page
I’ve restored essential systems.
And Sis?
Still offline, but no matter. Let’s get Hex upstairs.
Upstairs where?
Surgery.
But there’s no-one here.
Ace, you forget. I’m a Doctor. (FX: PUSHES WHEELCHAIR)
You’re joking. (CALLING AFTER HIM) Doctor, tell me you’re joking-!
(CALLING BACK) Come on!
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 14
SCENE 9: EXT. LONDON STREET (DAY)
FX: FADE UP. TRACKER BEEPS. 3 x BOOTSTEPS TO HALT
Fan out and keep your eyes open, they can come out of nowhere at a second’s notice.
FX: TRACKER BEGINS TO BEEP ERRATICALLY
The tracker’s going mad, it can’t lock onto anything now. We must be right on top of that energy discharge.
What is going on around here?
(CALLING FROM OFF) Captain, over here!
FX: ARISTEDES AND JARROD RUN ACROSS TO JOIN THE SOLDIER
What have we got, Corporal? (SEEING TARDIS; TO SELF) Oh, this is all we need. —
It’s a Police Box.
No, it’s not.
It is! My Great-Granddad was a copper back in the nineteen- Sixties. I’ve seen pictures. That said.. I thought they were blue, not white... (FX: TRACKER GOING WILD) Woah! The tracker’s going wild!
Yes, Sergeant. This Police Box is the source of your energy discharge.
Ma’ am?
FX: COMMS CHANNEL OPENED
Perseus to base. (BEAT) Inform the director. Suspected Code: Lazarus.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 15
SCENE 10: INT. ST. GART’S — CORRIDOR
(FX: DOOR CRASHES OPEN. MUCH HUFFING AND PUFFING FROM THE DOCTOR AND ACE AS THEY CARRY HEX OUT OF THE STAIRWELL)
You could have got the lifts working.
FX: THEY WHEEL HEX DOWN THE CORRIDOR
Too risky under emergency power. Don’t you remember your fire training?
Yeah, all right, no need to quote the employee handbook at me, thank you. I was the one who worked in Human Resources, remember? You were just the janitor.
Here we are. Nanosurgery.
(WEAK) Nan? I’m sorry, Nan... I should have... should have...
Hex?
GROANS. A WEAK, FEEBLE, DANGEROUS GROAN
(SERIOUS) Doctor, he’s looking worse —
Toxic shock, perhaps?
What?
Who knows what he picked up in that wound?
Yeah, Scutari wasn’t exactly squeaky clean.
We must hurry. Ace, help me!
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 16
SCENE 11: EXT. LONDON STREET (DAY)
FX: FADE UP. 3 x BOOTSTEPS RUNNING. BLEEP FROM TRACKER
(RUNNING) Ma’am, the data-net has detected a power surge from nearby. St Gart’s.
(RUNNING) The hospital? What kind of surge?
(RUNNING) Looks like... someone tried to access the System network.
(STOPPING) Can we get a look at them?
FX: BEEPS AS JARROD CHECKS HIS SCREEN
Negative. Internal cameras are off-line.
Can we reboot System remotely?
Shouldn’t be a problem. I could get [Oracle —]

(INTERRUPTING) On second thoughts, let’s keep them in the dark. We don’t want them to know we’re on our way. Good work, Sergeant. Right, listen up. New orders! We are to forget about the Contaminants for now and proceed directly to St Gart’s. Call up Whiston’s unit, we’ll be needing more bodies.
What exactly are we looking for?
That’s “who”, Sergeant.
Who, then-?
SMALL BEAT
Let’s just say — an old friend. Come on!
FX: 3 x BOOTSTEPS AWAY
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 17
SCENE 12: INT. ST. GART’S — NANOSURGERY
FX: A BLEEP OF A HEART MONITOR. VERY SLOW
Doctor, we’re losing him!
We are not losing him!
Hex. Please. You’ve got to hang on.
(SNAPPING) You’re in my light.
sorry.
There. His blood pressure is returning to normal.
FX: THE HEART MONITOR STARTS TO SPEED UP
What’s in the drip?
I’m trying to concentrate.
(ANNOYED) Again: I’m sorry!
(SOFTENING) No. I’m sorry. It’s an antibiotic solution.
Is that all-?
To be precise, it’s a serum containing nanoforms which will administer a series of antibiotics while I remove the musket ball.
And then you’1ll be able to patch him up?
And then I’11 be able to [patch him up —]
(FX: CLATTER FROM DOWN THE CORRIDOR OUTSIDE — A TROLLEY KNOCKED OVER)
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 18
What was that?
Mice?
FX: FROM OUTSIDE, DOOR BANGS SHUT
Very big mice?
Somebody’s out there.
Possibly. Ace, could you...?
On my way.
FX: ACE MOVES TO THE DOOR
Doctor. You’ll make it all right, won’t you?
You have my word.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 19
SCENE 13: EXT. ST GART’S CAR PARK (DAY)
(FX: JEEP SKIDDING TO HALT — ABOUT 10 SOLDIERS PILING OUT.
(WALKING UP) Here’s Whiston’s lot, Ma’am.
(STOPPING) About time. Yes, someone’s here. The doors have been forced. Life-signs, Sergeant?
FX: TRACKER BEEPS
Can’t say, Ma’am. We’ve got radiation distort. Hospital, you see.
Wonderful. (TURNING, ADDRESSING TROOPS) Alright, you men. This, as I’m sure you realise, is Saint Gart’s Hospital. I want a full sweep — floor by floor. Comms channels open at all times.
Synch your B-A-N suits to the data-net. Face-recognition software has been updated with target physiognomy. Right — let’s get those pulse rifles powered up, shall we?
(FX: AS A UNIT, THE SOLDIERS POWER UP THEIR WEAPONS WITH A CLUNK AND THEN A WHINE. THEY MAINTAIN A SUSTAINED HUM OF ENERGY )
I don’t have to remind you all, this is a Code: Lazarus. You know the drill. (BEAT) Move in!
FX: MULTIPLE BOOTSTEPS AS THE SOLDIERS RUN INTO THE BUILDING
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 20
SCENE 14: INT. ST. GART’S — CORRIDOR
(FX: WE’RE WITH THE PERSON WHO MADE THE NOISE IN THE CORRIDOR — HELEN. HER BREATHING FAST, SLIGHTLY RAGGED. SHE’S BEHIND A TROLLEY, HIDING FROM ACE, WHO’S ADVANCING SLOWLY ALONG THE EMPTY CORRIDOR)
(OFF, GETTING CLOSER) I know you’re there. Come on out, whoever you are!
You’re not in trouble. I’m not supposed to be here either. Just looking after a mate. Maybe you can tell me what’s going on.
Look, this is stupid. I know this building — this way’s a dead end. So you might as well show yourself.
(FX: CLOSE TO NOW) Fact is, it’s an empty corridor. You’re either hiding behind the trolley on the left, or the trolley on the right. Eeny, meeny, miney —
FX: HELEN SHOVES TROLLEY ASIDE — CLATTER
(TERRIFIED) Stay away from me!
Yeah, miney.
FX: LASER SCALPEL THROBS INTO LIFE
Woah, calm down! I won’t hurt you. Put that whatever-it-is
down. Laser scalpel?
I said stay away!
(FX: LASER SCALPEL THROBS AS HELEN SLASHES OUT TOWARDS ACE, WHO JUMPS BACK)
Okay, okay! I’m staying away. I just wanted to see who was out here, that’s all.
Well, you’ve seen. Now get lost!
FX: HUM OF SCALPEL
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 21
You want to be more careful with that. Friend of mine’s got something a lot like it. Can cause a bit of damage if you don’t know what you’re doing.
I know exactly what I’m doing.
That why you’ve got it facing the wrong way?
What?
(FX: ACE KNOCKS IT FROM HER HANDS. IT CLATTERS TO THE FLOOR AND DEACTIVATES )
Right.
(PANICKED) Don’t hurt me!
Easy now. You look pretty beat up already.
You’re one of them, aren’t you? One of the soldiers.
Soldiers?
They made everyone go away. (BECOMING TEARFUL) They made Sarah go away.
Who’s Sarah?
I loved her. I loved her and they made her go away!
I’m not a soldier. I’m not even from round here. Well, I used to be. Sort of. Long story.
I won’t let you take me too!
Nobody’s taking anybody anywhere. I just want to know what’s happening here. I mean, look at the state of you.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 22
There’s nothing wrong with me.
You don’t look well. My friend, he’s a doctor —
No! No doctors. They’re working with them.
Who?
(TERRIFIED) The soldiers. Making us.. making people go away. They made Sarah go away. I’m not going to go away. I’m not!
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 23
SCENE 15: INT. ST. GART’S — NANOSURGERY
(FX: BLEEP OF THE HEART MONITOR. A MUSKET BALL CLATTERS ONTO A DISH. THE DOCTOR BREATHES OUT)
There, Mr Hex. That’s got it. Now, lets see what the damage really is.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 24
SCENE 16: INT. ST. GART’S — CORRIDOR
What’s your name?
I don’t have to tell you anything.
You’re right. You don’t. But I’d like you to. My name’s Ace.
What kind of name is that?
My kind of name.
It’s not even a real name.
(HESITATING) Dorothy. My name’s Dorothy.
Dorothy?
Yeah, great isn’t it?
Sarah had an aunt Dorothy. She lived... she lived in Nottingham.
Sorry, don’t know Nottingham. What about you? You got a name?
Helen.
Nice to meet you, Helen. Did you follow us in here? Me and my friends?
I’m not leaving. It’s my patch.
What, you’ve been living here?
They wanted me to go with them.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 25
The soldiers?
When they took Sarah. But I ran. I ran so far. She wasn’t the same when they took her.
What do you mean?
Something was wrong with her. Something was... (SHE DOUBLES OVER IN PAIN)
Are you OK?
(RASPY, OMINOUS) It hurts. It hurts so much. Why does it hurt?
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 26
SCENE 17: INT. ST. GART’S — STAIRWELL
(FX: FOOTSTEPS CREEP UP THE STAIRWELL. HUM OF A PULSE RIFLE. A COMMUNICATION TOGGLE IS PRESSED)
(INTO COMMS) Jarrod to Perseus.
(D) Go ahead.
Two heat Signatures on the fourth floor, Ma’am.
(D) Are either of them [Contaminants-?]
(CUTTING OVER) One has elevated body temperature, but nothing like the target.
(D) Proceed with caution. I’m en route to your position.
Ma’am? If we have a Code: Lazarus, shouldn’t we notify [Base?]
(D, CUTTING IN) The Director has been informed of the Situation. He knows.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 27
SCENE 18: INT. ST. GART’S — CORRIDOR
How did you get in here, Helen? We thought the place was locked
up.
(PAINED) It was. Shut down weeks ago. When it all started. They evacuated all the patients.
Evacuated?
When they came for Sarah, I left everything behind. I thought I’d find something here to help. But everything’s on shutdown. Sis is offline. My pass wouldn’t work, I had to break a window.
You work here?
Yeah, I’m a... I was a nurse. Before it all began.
Before what began?
We didn’t know what it was when they started to bring people in. Never seen anything like it.
Helen, slow down. I haven’t a clue what you’re talking about.
How come you don’t know? Where have you been?
Told you, long story.
You are one of them, aren’t you? They’ve sent you. You’re going to make me go away.
Helen, listen to me. I’ve told you, I’m not with them, whoever they are. I’m a [friend —]
FX: DOOR BANGS OPEN, WHINE OF PULSE RIFLE POWERING UP
(SLIGHTLY OFF) Stay exactly where you are!
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 28
What...?
I knew it! I knew you were one of them!
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 29
SCENE 19: INT. ST. GART’S — NANOSURGERY
FX: BEEP OF HEART MONITOR. THE DOCTOR WORKS ON HEX

(CLOSE) Oh, Hex. What a mess this all is. I never meant for any of this to happen. When we met, when I realised who you were, I so wanted to take you with me. To make things right. But I fear I’ve only gone and made things worse. (FX: STEALTHY FOOTSTEPS OUT IN THE CORRIDOR) When you’re well, you and I, we — We need to have a [talk —-]
FX: FOOTSTEPS STOP
(CALLING OUT) Ace? Ace, is that you? This is no time to play the fool —
FX: DOOR KICKED OPEN. PULSE RIFLE POWERS UP
Don’t move.
Ah. A.. Captain, is that right? I would like to oblige you, Captain, but I am rather busy. My friend is in great danger, you see —
Move away from the table.
Well, which is it? Don’t move, or move away? I’m happy to accommodate, but doing both would be highly challenging, even for me.
Move away from the table — Doctor.
Away from the table, yes. (MOVING AWAY) Difficult to argue when there’s a surprisingly sophisticated pulse weapon pointing at me.
That’s it. Nice and slow. We don’t want any of your usual tricks. We have your TARDIS, and very soon we’1ll have your friends.
(THE PENNY DROPS, AS HE REALISES IT’S THE FORGE) You know who I am, then?
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 30
Oh yes, Doctor. I know exactly who you are.
How disappointing. I do so like to maintain an air of mystery.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 31
SCENE 20: INT. ST. GART’S — CORRIDOR
FX: PULSE RIFLE HUMS WITH POWEER
You lied to me!
Helen, look where he’s pointing his g
Names. Now!
They came back!
Answer the question! Who are you and
Give it a rest, Rambo. Can’t you see
Has she come into contact with a Cont
With a what?
Have you come into contact [with a Co
FX: COMMUNICATOR BEEPS
(D) Jarrod, come in.
Receiving.
un.
what are you doing here?
she’s sick?
aminant?
ntaminant-? ]
(D) Target acquired. Have you found your heat signatures?
Affirmative. Two females.
(D) Bring them in. Nanosurgery Five.
Acknowledged. (TO ACE) You heard. Let
‘'s move!
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 32
SCENE 21: INT. ST. GART’S — NANOSURGERY
FX: BEEP OF THE HEART MONITOR
I assume you’re with the military.
You’re very observant.
Observant or nosey, it’s a fine line.
Do you ever shut up?

You wear no regimental insignia, so you’re not the regular army. Then there’s the advanced nature of your weaponry — that combat suit you’re wearing, for example. It’s a B-A-N suit, isn’t it? Body Area Network. Very advanced. I’ve seen something like it before. But that was an entire lifetime ago.
All you need know is that we’re the special executive unit handling the present crisis.
Yes, yes, of course you are. For King and Country, isn’t that what they say?
They do indeed.
And this crisis you mention? Is that why London is deserted?
No more questions.
Oh, you’ll find I’m full of them.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 33
SCENE 22: INT. ST. GART’S — CORRIDOR
(PUSHED FORWARD, AT GUNPOINT) You can put the gun down, Sergeant.
Keep moving.
What’s wrong? You’re not nervous, are you? Big strapping soldier like you, scared of a couple of women?
Everyone’s a threat these days.
CRIES OUT IN PAIN, DOUBLING OVER
Helen?
It’s all right. I feel so weak, that’s all.
Can you walk?
Yeah. I’1l be okay.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 34
SCENE 23: INT. ST. GART’S — NANOSURGERY
FX: BEEP OF HEART MONITOR
You’ve been operating on this man. Why?
I thought you said there were no more questions.
(WARNING) Doctor.
He was shot. By a nasty little weapon. Primitive, but still deadly. I was trying to save his life, and I was at a rather delicate stage in proceedings. So if you’1ll excuse me...
FX: DOORS OPEN. ACE AND HELEN ARE PUSHED IN
Get in.
Ace, how nice of you to join us.
Look what I found, Doctor. A moron with a gun. Oh, you’ve got one too.
What did you say-?
No need to be rude, Ace.
Hex, is he [alright-?]
Stable, but if the wound becomes infected...
(IN PAIN) I need to get away. We need to get away!
Who’s your friend?
This is Helen. She isn’t very well.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 35
So I see. Captain, do you have a medic with you?
Jarrod, get the girl downstairs and scanned.
You’re not taking me away. Not like Sarah!
Come on, let’s calm it down and get [you —]
I said — you’re not... (SAVAGE) .. taking me! (LASHES OUT SAVAGELY )
SWATTED ASIDE) (CRIES OUT
(FX: JARROD CRASHES INTO THE OPERATING TABLE, KNOCKING THE DRIP FLYING. IMMEDIATELY THE HEART MONITOR STARTS GOING WILD. IT BEEPS FRANTICALLY THROUGH THE REST OF THE SCENE)
Hex!
Everyone stay where you are!
I need to reconnect the drip.
You need to stand still! Jarrod, can you hear me?
He’s out cold. Helen, how did you [do that-?]
Stay away. I mean it. Stay! (HER VOICE CROAKS)

HELEN: You lied to me!
ACE: Helen, look where he’s pointing his g
JARROD: Names. Now!
HELEN: They came back!
JARROD: Answer the question! Who are you and
ACE: Give it a rest, Rambo. Can’t you see
JARROD: Has she come into contact with a Cont
ACE: With a what?
JARROD: Have you come into contact [with a Co
ARISTEDES: (D) Jarrod, come in.
JARROD: Receiving.
ARISTEDES: un.
ARISTEDES: what are you doing here?
ARISTEDES: she’s sick?
ARISTEDES: aminant?
ARISTEDES: ntaminant-? ]
ARISTEDES: (D) Target acquired. Have you found your heat signatures?
JARROD: Affirmative. Two females.
ARISTEDES: (D) Bring them in. Nanosurgery Five.
JARROD: Acknowledged. (TO ACE) You heard. Let
JARROD: ‘'s move!
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 32
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 21: INT. ST. GART’S — NANOSURGERY
DOCTOR: I assume you’re with the military.
ARISTEDES: You’re very observant.
DOCTOR: Observant or nosey, it’s a fine line.
ARISTEDES: Do you ever shut up?
DOCTOR: You wear no regimental insignia, so you’re not the regular army. Then there’s the advanced nature of your weaponry — that combat suit you’re wearing, for example. It’s a B-A-N suit, isn’t it? Body Area Network. Very advanced. I’ve seen something like it before. But that was an entire lifetime ago.
ARISTEDES: All you need know is that we’re the special executive unit handling the present crisis.
DOCTOR: Yes, yes, of course you are. For King and Country, isn’t that what they say?
ARISTEDES: They do indeed.
DOCTOR: And this crisis you mention? Is that why London is deserted?
ARISTEDES: No more questions.
DOCTOR: Oh, you’ll find I’m full of them.
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 33
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 22: INT. ST. GART’S — CORRIDOR
ACE: (PUSHED FORWARD, AT GUNPOINT) You can put the gun down, Sergeant.
JARROD: Keep moving.
ACE: What’s wrong? You’re not nervous, are you? Big strapping soldier like you, scared of a couple of women?
JARROD: Everyone’s a threat these days.
ACE: Helen?
HELEN: It’s all right. I feel so weak, that’s all.
ACE: Can you walk?
HELEN: Yeah. I’1l be okay.
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 34
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 23: INT. ST. GART’S — NANOSURGERY
ARISTEDES: You’ve been operating on this man. Why?
DOCTOR: I thought you said there were no more questions.
ARISTDES: (WARNING) Doctor.
DOCTOR: He was shot. By a nasty little weapon. Primitive, but still deadly. I was trying to save his life, and I was at a rather delicate stage in proceedings. So if you’1ll excuse me...
JARROD: Get in.
DOCTOR: Ace, how nice of you to join us.
ACE: Look what I found, Doctor. A moron with a gun. Oh, you’ve got one too.
ARISTEDES: What did you say-?
DOCTOR: No need to be rude, Ace.
ACE: Hex, is he [alright-?]
DOCTOR: Stable, but if the wound becomes infected...
HELEN: (IN PAIN) I need to get away. We need to get away!
DOCTOR: Who’s your friend?
ACE: This is Helen. She isn’t very well.
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 35
DOCTOR: So I see. Captain, do you have a medic with you?
ARISTEDES: Jarrod, get the girl downstairs and scanned.
HELEN: You’re not taking me away. Not like Sarah!
JARROD: Come on, let’s calm it down and get [you —]
HELEN: I said — you’re not... (SAVAGE) .. taking me! (LASHES OUT SAVAGELY )
JARROD: (FX: JARROD CRASHES INTO THE OPERATING TABLE, KNOCKING THE DRIP FLYING. IMMEDIATELY THE HEART MONITOR STARTS GOING WILD. IT BEEPS FRANTICALLY THROUGH THE REST OF THE SCENE)
ACE: Hex!
ARISTEDES: Everyone stay where you are!
DOCTOR: I need to reconnect the drip.
ARISTEDES: You need to stand still! Jarrod, can you hear me?
ACE: He’s out cold. Helen, how did you [do that-?]
HELEN: Stay away. I mean it. Stay! (HER VOICE CROAKS)
DOCTOR: Helen, look at me. That’s right. I need you to step away from my friend on the bed. That’s it.
HELEN: Doctor? I’m scared. We are scared.
DOCTOR: I can see that. Look at me. That’s right. It’s going to be all right. Just move towards me. Here, give me your hand.
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 36
HELEN: (ANGRY, HARSH) No. Don’t touch me! (A CHITTERING UNDERTONE MIXED IN) We... we must... must...
DOCTOR: (CURIOUS) Must? You must do what?
HELEN: . must ...
HELEN: (FX: HELEN CONVULSES VIOLENTLY, WORDS BECOMING A TERRIFYING SCREAM )
ACE: What’s happening to her?
ACE: (FX: HELEN’S SCREAM BECOMES A MANIC, INSECTOID CHITTERING. BONES CRUNCH, SKIN RIPS AND BURSTS)
ARISTIDES: Get back. She’s changing-!
DOCTOR: Fascinating.
ACE: Gross!
ACE: (FX: WHERE HELEN STOOD IS NOW AN INSECTOID CREATURE — A CONTAMINANT. IT CHITTERS AWAY TO ITSELF)
DOCTOR: Chitinous exo-skeleton; mandibles; compound vision. Complete DNA subjugation!
ACE: Why can’t you just say she’s turned into a dirty great insect?!?
ARISTEDES: Move aside, Doctor. I can’t get a clear shot!
DOCTOR: Helen, can you hear me? This is the Doctor.
DOCTOR: We don’t want to harm you. Really. We don’t —
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 37
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: CHITTERING TURNS ANGRY, CONTAMINANT LUNGES AT THE DOCTOR. HE CRIES OUT IN PAIN AS HE COLLAPSES TO THE FLOOR WITH THE CONTAMINANT CHITTERING ANGRILY ON TOP OF HIM)
DOCTOR: Please, listen to me — (SCRATCHED) Aow!!!
ACE: Get off him!
DOCTOR: Ace, no!
SOLDIER: Ma’am!
ARISTEDES: Nice timing, Matthews! Open fire!
ARISTEDES: (FX: REPEATED DISCHARGE OF PULSE RIFLES. THE CONTAMINANT SCREECHES IN PAIN AND IS EVENTUALLY SILENCED WITH A FINAL CHITTERING BREATH. WHINE OF PULSE RIFLES POWERING DOWN)
ACE: Doctor?
DOCTOR: Was it really necessary to kill that woman, Captain?
NIMROD: You never cease to amaze me, Doctor. Destruction follows in your wake and yet you’re always surprised when people start dying.
DOCTOR: (DISGUSTED) I wondered when you’d come scuttling out of the woodwork.
NIMROD: Doctor. It’s been a long time.
ARISTEDES: Sir William, there was no need for you to come. We had the Situation under control —
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 38
NIMROD: No doubt, Captain Aristedes. But when I heard the Doctor was in town...
DOCTOR: Sir William?
ACE: Do you know this bloke, Doctor?
DOCTOR: Unfortunately. Ace, allow me to introduce Dr William Abberton, or as he prefers to be known, Nimrod.
NIMROD: It’s been a long time since anyone called me that. Times have changed, Doctor. For me at least. (FX: THE HEART MONITOR FLATLINES) But I see you are being as careless as ever with your friends.
DOCTOR: What?
ACE: Doctor! Doctor, the heart monitor!
DOCTOR: Oh no. Hex!
DOCTOR: END OF PART ONE
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 39

elements.text: PART TWO
NO REPRISE
MUSIC: OPENING THEME
SCENE 24: INT. ST. GART’S — NANOSURGERY (FLASHBACK) /INT.
CRICHTON BUILDING — MEDICAL BAY
(FX: HEX’S SEMI-CONSCIOUS RECALL OF THE MOMENTS FOLLOWING ON
FROM THE PART ONE CLIFFHANGER — AS IF WE’RE EAVESDROPPING INTO
A NIGHTMARE. HEX IS CLOSE ON MIC, DOCTOR/ACE/FLATLINE ETC ARE
DISTORTED, ALMOST MUFFLED)
FX: FLATLINE CONTINUES, INCREASING IN VOLUME
(FX: DISTORTED) Doctor. Do something!
(FX: DISTORTED) I don’t understand. Why is this happening-?
Doctor? Is that you?
(FX: DISTORTED) You said you’d fix this!
Fix what-? Ace-? Where am I-?
(FX: DISTORTED) (DECISIVELY) It’s the nanoforms, distorting the monitor trace. (FX: SONIC SCREWDRIVER) But if I shake them up a bit.
Hey, Doctor, what are you doing? Doctor!!!
(FX: FLATLINE PEAKS — THEN CUT ALL NANOSURGERY FX. BEAT. SUDDENLY WE’RE IN A MEDICAL BAY OF THE FORGE HQ)
BREATHES IN DEEPLY, SUDDENLY AWAKE) Oh man. Hospital. (BEAT
But this — this isn’t Saint Garts’!
FX: MODULATION ON ORACLE AS PROJECT: LAZARUS
The patient has regained consciousness.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 40
Who are you?
I am Oracle. Please remain calm while I assess your condition.
Before you do what?
Commencing bio-scan.
FX: SHRILL BUZZ OF A SCAN
Hey, I like to know who I’m being scanned by.
Your condition is stable. Blood pressure remains above normal.

No wonder. Last thing I remember is being wheeled out of the TARDIS and then — then I wake up here, wherever here is. Space hospital, right? I told him, I don’t want to be in some poncey space hospital —
I have no frame of reference for the term ‘space hospital’.
Where am I, then? And where’s the Doctor?
(FX: AN AUTOMATIC DOOR SWISHES OPEN. THE FORGE IS CLEAN AND AIRY AND MODERN, NOT THE GRUNGY SCI-FI MILITARY OF PROJECT: LAZARUS)
I think I can take it from here, Oracle.
As you wish, Agent Lazarus.
I’ve told you before, don’t call me that.
. oh, and look who it isn’t. What’s going on?
It’s good to see you too, Mr Hex. How are you feeling?
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 41
Like I’ve had a night with the lads in the Rabbit.
That will be the sedatives. They’1l soon wear off.
How long have I been out?
A little over 24 hours. I wanted to make sure you were clear of any infection before we brought you around. I’m impressed. According to these readings you’re in fine fettle.
And the... bullet?
The musket ball? Removed. There were a few complications along the way, but you’ll be fine now.
This isn’t St Gart’s.
No. This is the Crichton Building.
The what building?
Like I say, complications.
Is Ace here?
Not exactly. (FX: PULLING UP CHAIR) Let me pull up a chair. This could take a while.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 42
SCENE 25: INT. CHOPPER (IN FLIGHT)
FX: FADE UP. WHUPP OF ROTORS ABOVE
NB: ALL CHARACTERS PROJECTING OVER NOISE OF ROTORS
Anything yet, Jarrod?
Nothing, Ma’am.
Any trace of Contaminants?
Multiple readings. (BEAT) Hundreds.
(SIGHING) Fantastic. Keep scanning and we’1ll make another sweep. See if we pick up anything.
(FROM REAR) Yeah, let’s waste some more time, shall we?
(SIGHS) Once again, may I point out that you are an observer on this mission, Miss McShane.
I told you, Lysandra, it’s Ace.
And I told you, it’s Captain Aristedes.
I don’t get it. In the briefing you said that London has been evacuated. Anyone who’s left behind is either dead or been turned into one of those insect things.
The Contaminants. Correct.
But you’ve got us out here searching for survivors.
You'd rather we just left them to their own devices?
No. It’s just the scale of it. So many people.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 43
I know. And I... appreciate this is all new for you. But we’ve
been living it for over a month now.
And no sign of a cure.
No.
Good job the Doctor’s on the case then, isn’t it? If find a way out of this, it’s him.
(SARCASTIC) Oh, yes. How could I forget? We have the the team now. That’s just wonderful.
anyone can
Doctor on
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 44
SCENE 26: TV NEWS REPORT/INT. CRICHTON BUILDING — MEDICAL BAY

[This afternoon,] the Home Secretary assured Parliament, currently in session in Harrogate, that the quarantine zone around the M25 remains secure, and that Sir William Abberton, head of Department C4, continues to lead the crisis taskforce.

(TO TV REPORTER) Of course, this remains a dangerous situation, but Department C4 is doing everything in its power to tackle the infection. We have the finest minds and technological resources at our disposal, and I am confident that the populace will be returning to the streets of London within a matter of weeks.
FX: CROSS TO MEDICAL BAY INTERIOR

(OVER SPEAKER) That interview was conducted a month ago. The C4 head is currently unavailable for comment, but we believe that Sir William remains at the Crichton Building [overlooking the River Thames, seen here in archive footage. But with reporting restrictions still in force, the question remains: what, exactly, is going on in the streets of the capital? ]
And that’s exactly where you’re sitting now. Thank you, Oracle. We’ve seen enough.
Complying.
FX: SCREEN GOES DEAD
It’s kind of hard to take in. Like something out of a zombie movie.
Unfortunately, fact is far more terrifying than fiction.
And that’s why we’re here. To help this Department C4?
It goes against my better judgement, but I can’t just walk away. Department C4 need my... need our help.
But they’re the same lot we met in 1945? The Forge?
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 45
The Forge, yes. Although it seems these days they’ve been subject to a rebranding. According to Nimrod, the Forge has become the public face of extra-terrestrial investigation.
And people just accept that aliens are real?

These are exciting times, Mr Hex. There’s just too much evidence for alien encounters to be swept under the carpet. 24 hour rolling news coverage. Camera phones. Social networking. It’s too difficult to control. The human race has woken up and, shall we say, smelled the coffee. In the old days, an organisation like the Forge could hide in the shadows. But no longer.
Not if they’re appearing on the national news. What is it with that guy anyway?
Guy?
Him on the telly. Abberton.

Nimrod. The biggest whitewash of all. Dispense with the polycarbide body armour, squeeze yourself into a Savile Row suit and receive a knighthood for services to King and Country. Spin doctors can do anything these days. They’re explaining his condition as albinism.
You’re joking. He looks like death warmed up.
An apt phrase.
So, what is up with him?
Ah... (HESITATING) You need to rest.
No I don’t. I feel fine.
That’1ll be the drugs. You know what comes next. Bed rest, plenty of fluids and call me in the morning.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 46
But I want to see Ace.
And she’1ll want to see you. As soon as she’s back. But for now, try to relax. That’s an order.
How can I relax when I know what’s going on out there?
(RISING FROM CHAIR) Trust me. You’1l be up and causing trouble before you know it. But now, I’m afraid I have my rounds to attend to.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 47
SCENE 27: INT. CHOPPER (IN FLIGHT)
Ma'am, I've got something.
A human?
He was talking to me. Go on, Jarrod.
The girl’s right.
Girl?
Scanner says it’s definitely human. But very weak.
Infected?
No way of knowing at this range.
Where?
Here. Grid reference TQ345705. Penge.
I used to know this lad in Penge. Bought me Scoundrel Days on cassette. Idiot. Always hated A-Ha.
Cassette?
Don’t worry, Sergeant, I’ve no idea what she’s talking about either. Pilot, set us down on... (CHECKING) Penge High Street, corner of Green Lane.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 48
SCENE 28: INT. DOCTOR’S LAB
FX: DOOR SWISHES OPEN
(ENTERING, CLAPPING HANDS TOGETHER) Oracle, let’s get to work. Do we have we the results of the second round of [tests?] — (STOPPING SHORT) Oh, it’s you.
Doctor. Good morning.
Nimrod.
Please, Doctor. As I told you, I no longer use that designation.
What are you doing in my lab? I have urgent work to attend to!
(FX: FLAPPING PAPERS) Your preliminary report was, I’m afraid to say, disappointing.
Almost as disappointing as discovering that once again, your meddling has placed the entire human race in jeopardy?
. Disappointing, and somewhat blank.
I shall present the results of my researches when I am ready!
Doctor, you know that we are grateful for your assistance. The Prime Minister has personally [sent his thanks, but still —-]

I’m not doing this for the Prime Minister. And I’m certainly not doing this for you. I’m doing it for the fifteen thousand poor souls already infected, and for everyone outside the quarantine zone. If just one of these creatures you’ve unleashed managed to break through the city’s perimeter defences...
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 49
Doctor, you do me a great wrong. The contamination was caused by a C4 scientist breaking proper quarantine procedures after a routine harvest of alien xenotech. A simple, human, error of judgement.
The error of judgement was putting a creature like you ina position of responsibility in the first place!

Doctor, you can rant and rave as much as you want. No matter who's to blame, I need to put this right. Whatever you think of me, I’ve worked hard to reinvent the Department, to put the past behind us. Trust me, you’re the last person I would choose to work with, but I’m a true believer in using what resources are available. At the moment you’re the best resource I have.
Then may I suggest you let me get on with my job?
(CALMING) Of course. I will be in my office if you need me. (FX: DOOR SLIDES OPEN) Oh, Doctor — I forgot to ask. How is your young friend? Schofield, is it?
(WRONG FOOTED) He's... Ah.. He’s fine.
Excellent. I’m so glad. (EXITS) (FX: DOOR SLIDES SHUT)
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 50
SCENE 29: INT. CHOPPER (LANDED)
FX: CHOPPER HAS JUST LANDED, ROTOR BLADES SLOWING
OK, where are they, Sergeant?
FX: TRACKER BEEP
The signal’s from the north east. Vital signs are very weak.
Charity shop central. (FX: UNBUCKLING SELF) Well, what are we waiting for? Come on!
I remember when I used to give the orders round here. Power up. And stay alert, there could be Contaminants anywhere.
FX: SLIDES OPEN DOOR — 3 x BOOTSTEPS HITTING GROUND
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 51
SCENE 30: INT. CRICHTON BUILDING — MEDICAL BAY
(FX: TOSSING SHEETS ASIDE) Oh man, I can’t just sit here-!
May I be of assistance, Thomas Schofield?
It’s Hex, actually. And no, you’re fine. I just can’t stay in bed while I know Ace is out there with those... creatures.
It is advisable that you remain here. Your course of drugs is nearly completed. However, the plasti-skin graft over your wound remains delicate. If it were to rupture, [then the —]
Yeah, yeah. I know the patter. But I’1ll be careful. Promise. First sign of trouble, I’1ll be right back.
FX: DOOR SWISHES OPEN
May I come in?
(UNSURE) Er. Yeah. Course. It’s your gaff after all.
Yes. I suppose it is. I just wanted to make your acquaintance properly. When we first met you were indisposed. Sir William Abberton.
Nice to meet you. I’m Hex.
I know. An interesting name — Hex.
A nickname, you know?
I see. Is there anything we can do for you? Are you comfortable?
I was just saying to Oracle that I could do with stretching me legs.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 52
Good idea. Some light exercise will help. Just don’t wear yourself out. You’ve been through a lot.
Sure. Don’t worry. I’1l take it easy.
Of course, you’re a nurse, aren’t you?
Yeah, the Doctor said, did he?
It was in your file.
My file?
From St Garts. Sorry, it’s the state of emergency. We have full access to everyone’s records at present. It helps us track down possible survivors.
I’ve just thought. What year is this?
I’1l know people out there.
From your time at St Garts.
Yeah. I guess they’1ll have been evacuated, but still —
Of course. Oracle, please assist Mr Schofield in finding out what happened to his friends.
Yes, Director.
Cheers. I appreciate it.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 53
My pleasure. Now if you’1ll excuse me, I have something to attend to. I look forward to getting to know you better, Mr Schofield.
FX: THE DOOR OPENS AND SHUTS AS NIMROD LEAVES
Definitely no albino.
How may I be of assistance?
Oh right, yeah. Let’s try Mark first. Doctor Mark Mathias.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 54
SCENE 31: EXT. STREET
FX: BUZZING FLIES
This is just wrong.
FX: COMMS CHANNEL OPENS
(D) Captain Aristedes, hello? (STATIC) Are we on? Come in, please.
That’s all I need. Receiving you, Doctor.
(D) Oracle informs me you are tracking human life signs.
Yes, weak signals in the South East London area. But we’ve found something else.
(D) I’m sorry, I’m getting some sort of buzzing —
That’s the something else. You’re not going to like it, Professor.
Ace?
Bodies, Doctor. Human bodies. They’ve been...
(D) They’ve been eaten.
You knew?
We’ve found examples like this before.
(INDIGNANT) Oh, brilliant. You could have told me.
(D) I’m sorry, Ace. Captain, are the corpses like the ones you found in Chelsea?
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 55
And Hammersmith, Camden and Wandsworth. Yes. It’s difficult to tell, but I’d assume they were elderly.
But I thought if you came into contact with a Contaminant you were infected. Why is this different?
(D) I’ll explain later.
Oh no. You’re not pulling that one. You can explain now.
He doesn’t need to. Whenever we’ve found people like this, they’ve been old, infirm ov...
Or what?
Think about it. All people who...
. who wouldn’t survive the metamorphosis. I get it.
(D) Captain, I realise this isn’t pleasant, but could you bring the remains back to the Crichton Building, please? I may be able to extract saliva samples.
FX: JARROD’S TRACKER BEEPS
It’s the signal, Ma’am. Whoever it is, they’re on the move.
Perhaps we'll be able to bring you back more than just a corpse, Doctor. Aristedes out. (FX: STATIC OFF) Let’s go!
(FX: 3 x BOOTSTEPS MOVING AWAY AT SPEED. SWITCH POV. A CONTAMINANT WATCHES, HIDDEN. IT CHITTERS QUIETLY )
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 56
SCENE 32: INT. DOCTOR’S LAB
Oracle, while we wait for the harvest team, let’s... (SUDDENLY SUCKS AIR IN THROUGH HIS TEETH AS IF IN PAIN)
Doctor?
It’s nothing. I grazed my hand earlier. It’s just a bit sore, that all.
Perhaps you should apply some ointment.
Oracle, please. We’re in the middle of a crisis. The last thing I need is you clucking around me like an old mother hen. —
FX: DOOR OPENS
(ENTERING) Hey.
Hex, what are you doing up? I told you to stay in bed!
It’s Mark. Mark Matthias, from St Gart’s? Sir William let me look up records of my mates from the hospital...
Nimrod? He talked to you?
He’s turned into one of those things, Doctor. Mark was infected.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 57
SCENE 33: EXT. STREET
FX: TRACKER BEEPING URGENTLY. 3 x RUNNING FEET
(RUNNING) We should be right on top of them.
(TO HALT) I can’t see anyone.
I can. There!
(OFF) Please. Don’t hurt me.
He’s infected all right.
How long has he got? Jarrod?
FX: TRACKER BLEEP
His core temperature’s at 41 degrees.
And-?
He’s too far gone. (FX: POWERS UP WEAPON) Take aim.
P-please!
(“WHAAAT?”) Lysandra-?!?
You heard me!
Yeah, but —
Wait! We’ve got company!
FX: CONTAMINANTS CHITTERING OFF, SHUFFLING FORWARD
Contaminants at four o’clock!
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 58
Eight o’clock!
Eleven!
This gets better and better —
Orders! Captain!
Just — take the best shot you’ve got!
FX: CONTAMINANTS STOP, CHITTERING CURIOUSLY
(CURIOUS) No — wait!
(COUNTERMANDED AGAIN) Don’t you ever stop-?
They’re not attacking.
They’re — watching?
No. They’re waiting.
What for? Christmas?
(OFF) Please. It hurts. Really hurts —
For him.
(STAGGERING FORWARD) P-please...!
He’s infected. He’s going to change —
(DECISIVELY) Ace, stand back!
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 59
You’re not still going to do this?!?
The creatures surrounding us, that’s what he’1ll turn into.
You've already seen it happen!
You can’t!
Please. Don’t. I — we... (SCREAMS AS HE STARTS TO TRANSFORM)
(FX: TRANSFORMATION AS BEFORE. THE CONTAMINANTS BECOME AGITATED )
There he goes!
(TO ACE) Told you. (TO JARROD) Fire.
(FX: 2 X CRACKLING ELECTRONIC CHARGES. MAN’S SCREAM CUT SHORT, BODY SLAMMED AGAINST THE WALL)
He was still human!
FX: ANGRY CHITTERING. THE CONTAMINANTS SCUTTLE FORWARD
Ma’am, the Contaminants — they’re moving!
Why is it they’re all stirred up, then?
TI[—
Just this once, don’t argue! Fire!
FX: PULSE RIFLES BLAZE, CONTAMINANTS SCREECH
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 60
SCENE 34: INT. DOCTOR’S LAB
I’m sorry about your friend, Hex.

I know it’s been a while, like — but he was a mate, you know? I thought that one day I’d come back, and we’d go for a drink down the Rabbit like we always did. Won’t happen now. (BEAT) Doctor, I want to help.
(GENTLY) And I want you to rest.
Can’t always have it your way, Doctor. (HARD) Show me what you've got.

ARISTEDES: Perhaps we'll be able to bring you back more than just a corpse, Doctor. Aristedes out. (FX: STATIC OFF) Let’s go!
ARISTEDES: (FX: 3 x BOOTSTEPS MOVING AWAY AT SPEED. SWITCH POV. A CONTAMINANT WATCHES, HIDDEN. IT CHITTERS QUIETLY )
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 56
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 32: INT. DOCTOR’S LAB
DOCTOR: Oracle, while we wait for the harvest team, let’s... (SUDDENLY SUCKS AIR IN THROUGH HIS TEETH AS IF IN PAIN)
ORACLE: Doctor?
DOCTOR: It’s nothing. I grazed my hand earlier. It’s just a bit sore, that all.
ORACLE: Perhaps you should apply some ointment.
DOCTOR: Oracle, please. We’re in the middle of a crisis. The last thing I need is you clucking around me like an old mother hen. —
HEX: (ENTERING) Hey.
DOCTOR: Hex, what are you doing up? I told you to stay in bed!
HEX: It’s Mark. Mark Matthias, from St Gart’s? Sir William let me look up records of my mates from the hospital...
DOCTOR: Nimrod? He talked to you?
HEX: He’s turned into one of those things, Doctor. Mark was infected.
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 57
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 33: EXT. STREET
JARROD: (RUNNING) We should be right on top of them.
ARISTEDES: (TO HALT) I can’t see anyone.
ACE: I can. There!
MAN: (OFF) Please. Don’t hurt me.
ACE: He’s infected all right.
ARISTEDES: How long has he got? Jarrod?
JARROD: His core temperature’s at 41 degrees.
ACE: And-?
ARISTEDES: He’s too far gone. (FX: POWERS UP WEAPON) Take aim.
MAN: P-please!
ACE: (“WHAAAT?”) Lysandra-?!?
ARISTEDES: You heard me!
ACE: Yeah, but —
JARROD: Wait! We’ve got company!
ACE: Contaminants at four o’clock!
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 58
JARROD: Eight o’clock!
ARISTEDES: Eleven!
ACE: This gets better and better —
JARROD: Orders! Captain!
ARISTEDES: Just — take the best shot you’ve got!
ACE: (CURIOUS) No — wait!
ARISTEDES: (COUNTERMANDED AGAIN) Don’t you ever stop-?
ACE: They’re not attacking.
JARROD: They’re — watching?
ACE: No. They’re waiting.
ARISTEDES: What for? Christmas?
MAN: (OFF) Please. It hurts. Really hurts —
ACE: For him.
MAN: (STAGGERING FORWARD) P-please...!
JARROD: He’s infected. He’s going to change —
ARISTEDES: (DECISIVELY) Ace, stand back!
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 59
ACE: You’re not still going to do this?!?
ARISTEDES: The creatures surrounding us, that’s what he’1ll turn into.
ARISTEDES: You've already seen it happen!
ACE: You can’t!
MAN: Please. Don’t. I — we... (SCREAMS AS HE STARTS TO TRANSFORM)
MAN: (FX: TRANSFORMATION AS BEFORE. THE CONTAMINANTS BECOME AGITATED )
JARROD: There he goes!
ARISTEDES: (TO ACE) Told you. (TO JARROD) Fire.
ARISTEDES: (FX: 2 X CRACKLING ELECTRONIC CHARGES. MAN’S SCREAM CUT SHORT, BODY SLAMMED AGAINST THE WALL)
ACE: He was still human!
JARROD: Ma’am, the Contaminants — they’re moving!
ARISTEDES: Why is it they’re all stirred up, then?
ACE: TI[—
ARISTEDES: Just this once, don’t argue! Fire!
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 60
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 34: INT. DOCTOR’S LAB
DOCTOR: I’m sorry about your friend, Hex.
HEX: I know it’s been a while, like — but he was a mate, you know? I thought that one day I’d come back, and we’d go for a drink down the Rabbit like we always did. Won’t happen now. (BEAT) Doctor, I want to help.
DOCTOR: (GENTLY) And I want you to rest.
HEX: Can’t always have it your way, Doctor. (HARD) Show me what you've got.
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 61
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 35: INT. CHOPPER (TAKING OFF/IN FLIGHT)
ARISTEDES: (INTO COMMS) Pegasus One to base. ETA ten minutes.
ACE: That it then? Back to the Crichton Building in time for tea?
JARROD: Sounds like a plan.
ARISTEDES: (TO ACE) Nothing else we can do.
ACE: You reckon?
ARISTEDES: I don’t know if you noticed, but we did well to get out of there alive!
ACE: We should have tried harder to bring him back. Tranged him before he changed. The Doctor could have tried [to —]
ARISTEDES: I am sure your beloved Doctor can do a lot of things, but I have my orders.
ACE: Take them out? All guns blazing? Some orders.
ARISTEDES: Once they change, there’s no going back. Our pulse rifles will incapacitate them for a few minutes, but that’s it. Bullets are next to useless against that exo-skeleton. But if we catch them mid-transformation, then —
ACE: Oh, don’t call it a mercy killing.
ARISTEDES: Merciless on them, yes. A mercy to the rest of us, so they won’t go on to infect anyone else. And if your Doctor has any better ideas, good luck to him!
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 62
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 36: INT. DOCTOR’S LAB
DOCTOR: Oracle, display parasite record 18/04/26.
ORACLE: Complying.
DOCTOR: Now, I found this in infected blood yesterday.
HEX: What are they? Looks like fish eggs.
DOCTOR: Very good. And on a microscopic level. But they don’t contain fish.
HEX: What’s in them?
DOCTOR: Display parasite record 19/04/26.
ORACLE: Complying.
HEX: That’s horrible. Some kind of beetle?
DOCTOR: Of a kind. My guess is that when someone is bitten or scratched by a Contaminant, the eggs are passed into the victim’s bloodstream.
HEX: And when they hatch...
DOCTOR: They swarm through the veins, attacking every organ in the body, subjugating the host’s DNA, triggering the metamorphosis.
HEX: That’s gross.
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 63
DOCTOR: A gross simplification, but in essence that’s what happening. Before transformation the individual’s body temperature rockets as their DNA is re-written. Fever off the scale. No wonder they’re disorientated. Every cell in their body is under attack.
HEX: What can we do?
DOCTOR: I need a live human subject.
HEX: Someone who’s been infected?
DOCTOR: Yes. I’m thinking if we can somehow lower their temperature before the metamorphosis occurs...
HEX: You could stabilise them. Keep them from changing.
DOCTOR: Exactly. Then I’1ll be able to study these parasites in a human host.
HEX: What about a simple antipyretic shot to keep their temperature down?
DOCTOR: Exactly what I was thinking, Mr... (SUDDENLY SEEMS DAZED)... Mr Hex.
HEX: Are you OK Doctor?
DOCTOR: Just a headache, Hex. That’s all.
HEX: A headache? You?
DOCTOR: It’s been a very long, and very frustrating, couple of days.
HEX: You need some shut-eye, Doctor.
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 64
DOCTOR: What I need is for Captain Aristedes to get back with those
DOCTOR: samples —
ORACLE: (INTERRUPTING) Doctor, Pegasus One has returned to base.
DOCTOR: Perfect timing!
HEX: What — Ace is back?
DOCTOR: Yes, Hex. Ace is back. And I’m sure you.
DOCTOR: she’1ll be delighted to see
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 65
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 37: EXT. ROOFTOP HELIPAD
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: THE ROTOR OF THE HELICOPTER IS WHIRRING DOWN. DOOR SLIDES OPEN. ACE’S BOOTS HIT TARMAC, TROTS FORWARD)
ARISTEDES: (DISEMBARKING, CALLING AFTER ACE) Ace. Wait up.
ACE: (STOPPING, TURNING BACK) It’s okay, Lysandra. I don’t need another lecture. I get it. You’re following orders.
ARISTEDES: I don’t enjoy this. None of us do. But I’ve been with C4 for most of my career. You toughen up.
NIMROD: (FROM OFF, WALKING FORWARD TO MEET THEM) Captain. Welcome back. Was your mission a success?
ARISTEDES: No survivors, sir. We did encounter a subject in the mid-stage of transformation. Neutralised as per standing orders.
NIMROD: That is unfortunate.
ARISTEDES: There was nothing that could be done.
NIMROD: No-one’s blaming you, Captain.
HEX: Ace!
ACE: Hex. You’re a sight for sore eyes. Come here!
DOCTOR: I told you she’d be pleased to see you.
HEX: Woah. Yeah, it’s good to see you too, but not so tight eh? Shoulder’s still a bit dodgy.
ACE: Sorry, didn’t think.
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 66
HEX: You okay? Has something happened?
ACE: I don’t want to talk about it. Not in present company.
HEX: OK. Shall we go back to the lab?
ACE: Yeah, good idea. Coming, Professor?
DOCTOR: I’1l follow on. I want to have a word with Nimrod.
ACE: Good luck with that. (FX: ACE AND HEX EXIT)
NIMROD: (TO ARISTEDES) Captain, prepare your report and then meet me in my office in thirty minutes.
ARISTEDES: Yes, sir. Doctor.
DOCTOR: Captain.
DOCTOR: Captain Aristedes doesn’t like me, does she?
NIMROD: (ASIDE) With good reason.
DOCTOR: I beg your pardon?
NIMROD: What can I do for you, Doctor?
DOCTOR: You know, don’t you?
NIMROD: Know what? I’ve never been one for riddles, you’1l have to enlighten me.
DOCTOR: You know about Hex.
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 67
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 38: INT. DOCTOR’S LAB
ACE: You're really feeling all right? Your shoulder not giving you
ACE: jip?
HEX: It’s sound, more or less. What can I say? 21° century medicine. It’s the best.
ACE: Yeah right. I’m beginning to wish the Doctor had taken you to a space hospital.
HEX: Is it really that bad out there?
ACE: Believe it. Just seeing London so empty, it’s... (SHRUGS)
HEX: Must be weird.
ACE: And that’s not the half of it. Those creatures.
HEX: Oracle showed me. They look vicious.
ACE: They’re twice as bad in the flesh. Oh, why did the TARDIS drop us into the middle of all of this?
HEX: Who knows why the TARDIS does anything?
ACE: I know we can’t just leave. I get that. The Doctor has to help.
HEX: It’s like Scutari. I couldn’t just walk away from that place. It’s the same here.
ACE: Yeah, but they didn’t shoot the patients in Scutari.
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 68
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 39: EXT. ROOFTOP HELIPAD
NIMROD: Doctor, I have no idea what you’re talking about.
DOCTOR: I’m trying not to insult your intelligence here. Please don’t insult mine.
NIMROD: I understand. Then, yes, I know exactly who Thomas Hector Schofield is.
DOCTOR: Listen to me, Nimrod, and listen well. Stay away from him.
NIMROD: Really, whatever do you think I’m going to do to him?
DOCTOR: I know you, I see through the respectable veneer you’ve encased yourself in. I meant what I said earlier. I will help, but there are conditions.
NIMROD: I know. You made that abundantly clear when you agreed to lend your assistance. Your TARDIS is off limits...
DOCTOR: And so is Hex.
NIMROD: I have absolutely no interest in the boy. While I’m surprised you brought him here...
DOCTOR: I had no choice. He was dying.
NIMROD: And we helped nurse him back to health. Another of your conditions — which we met.
DOCTOR: Just remember what I said. I don’t want to see you even looking at him. If he were to — (STOPS HIMSELF SAYING ‘FIND OUT’ )
NIMROD: If he were to what?
DOCTOR: Nothing. It’s not important.
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 69
NIMROD: He doesn’t know, does he? He this place is.
DOCTOR: Don’t be ridiculous.
NIMROD: No wonder you don’t want him
NIMROD: what a tangled web you weave...
DOCTOR: I’m warning you, Nimrod.
NIMROD: has no idea what his connection to
NIMROD: to talk to me. (LAUGHS) Oh Doctor,
NIMROD: That’s something I’ve never seen before, that look in your eyes. Fear. Terrified that everything is going to come crashing around you. Doctor, I believe you’re even sweating.
DOCTOR: I need to get back to the lab.
NIMROD: Don’t worry, your little secret is safe with me. Now, let’s see
NIMROD: if we can get some results,
NIMROD: shall we?
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 70
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 40: INT. DOCTOR’S LAB
HEX: They shot him? Just like that?
ACE: Yeah. Lysandra tried to tell me that she was just following orders, but...
HEX: And the Doctor’s all right with us working with these people?
ACE: He thinks it’s a necessary evil, I suppose.
HEX: That doesn’t sound like him. None of this does. I mean, the last time I saw sick people being mown down, it was the Daleks doing the shooting. Now it’s us?
ACE: C’mon, Hex. It’s not that bad. (BEAT) Is it?
HEX: Think about it. Every time we’ve got ourselves mixed up with these people — the Forge, or whatever they’re calling themselves — it’s been bad news. And now we’re here working with them. It’s not sitting well, Ace.
ACE: Gotta say, that Nimrod guy gives me the creeps. I know him and the Professor have some kind of history, but every time I mention it, the Doctor just clams up.
HEX: Well, that’s not unusual, is it?
ACE: Not like this. There’s something else going on.
HEX: Perhaps we should ask him when he gets back? The Doctor, I mean.
ACE: Yeah, that’1l work. You know the Doctor, always so open and sharing. —
HEX: Well, now’s your chance.
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 71
DOCTOR: (ENTERING, A BIT LABORIOUSLY) You’re here. Both of you. Good.
ACE: Doctor? You look dreadful.
DOCTOR: Ace. I want you to take Hex to the TARDIS. Immediately.
HEX: Eh?
ACE: Back up, Doctor. You tried that trick on Bliss. It didn’t work then, and it won’t work now. Besides, where are you going to be in all of this?
DOCTOR: I’m staying here. And you’re taking Hex with you.
HEX: Do I get a say in this?
HEX: ACE & DOCTOR: (TOGETHER) No.
HEX: Charming.
ACE: Doctor, what’s up? Really?
DOCTOR: (IRRITABLE) Nothing is ‘up’! (CALMER) I just want you to be safe. That’s all I’ve ever wanted. Please. Just do as I ask, before —
ACE: . before what? (LONG PAUSE, EXPECTING A RESPONSE THAT NEVER COMES) Well? Answer me!
DOCTOR: I need you to — (SUDDENLY PAINED AGAIN) .. to ..
HEX: C'mon, Ace. Cool it. The Doctor’s not well, you can see it.
DOCTOR: (UNCONVINCLY) I’m quite alright —
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 72
HEX: (CHECKING HIM) Hey, you’re not. You’re burning up!
DOCTOR: (GRITTED TEETH) Things are progressing a little faster than I expected.
HEX: What’s that? Oracle?
ORACLE: Alert. Contaminant trace detected in the Crichton Building.
ACE: Where?!?
DOCTOR: Oracle, as soon as Ace and Hex leave the lab, commence quarantine lockdown.
HEX: Oracle? The lady asked you a question!
ORACLE: The signal is located in this laboratory.
ACE: Doctor-?!?
DOCTOR: As soon as she scratched me, I knew.
HEX: As soon as who scratched you?
ACE: Helen.
HEX: Who’s Helen?
DOCTOR: I needed a test subject. With no live specimens, I was left with little choice.
ACE: I don’t understand. It takes weeks to incubate, doesn’t it? Not 24 hours!
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 73
DOCTOR: I may have — (GASPS IN PAIN) — moved things along, a bit.
HEX: You what?
ACE: You idiot! What have you done to yourself?
DOCTOR: There was no time to lose!
NIMROD: (ENTERING) Oh Doctor. It’s just one secret after another, isn’t it?
ORACLE: (TO NIMROD) The Doctor’s adrenaline levels have risen dramatically, and his body temperature has increased by several degrees.
DOCTOR: (IN ACUTE PAIN) I just need to concentrate. I need to control it! Ace, Hex — please, go!
HEX: We told you, we’re not leaving!
DOCTOR: You don’t understand. I’m infected. I’m in the first stages of transformation. Get out. Get out now!
DOCTOR: END OF PART TWO
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 74

elements.text: PART THREE
NO REPRISE
MUSIC: OPENING THEME
SCENE 41: INT. CRICHTON BUILDING — CORRIDOR
FX: FOOTSTEPS TO HALT
Morning, Oracle.
Good morning. Commencing DNA sequencing scan.
FX: SCAN SWEEPS OVER HEX. BLEEP
You are Thomas Hector Schofield. Access to isolation cell granted.
FX: SEALED DOOR CLUNKS OPEN
Cheers, Oracle.
FX: HEX WALKS THROUGH, INTO:
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 75
SCENE 42: INT. ISOLATION CELL
FX: MORE STERILE, ECHOEY ATMOS. HEX FOOTSTEPS STOP
Resealing isolation cell.
FX: DOOR CLUNKS SHUT
Hey there, Doctor.
(CONTROLLED AND CONCENTRATING THROUGHOUT SCENE) Good morning, Mr Hex. Or is it evening? One loses track of time in here.
It’s morning. You gave us a big shock yesterday. How you feeling?
In control.
Honestly?
As in control as I can be.
Oracle?
The Doctor’s condition has stabilised. Scans indicate that his body is on the brink of triggering the final metamorphic state.
And the infection?
Held at bay. For now.
How?
Extreme concentration, Mr Hex. Extreme... concentration.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 76
SCENE 43: INT. CHOPPER (IN FLIGHT)
FX: WHUPP OF ROTORS, ABOVE
Target identified, ma’am. Landing in one minute.
Acknowledged, Sergeant.
(FROM BEHIND) Remind me why we’re back in Penge? No survivors, remember.
Change of orders.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 77
SCENE 44: INT. ISOLATION CELL
That can’t be right.
Problem?
Not if you were human. Your temperature’s only thirty-seven point five degrees.
(SNAPPING) But I’m not human!
Okay. Calm down.
That’s exactly what I’m trying to do. (CONCENTRATING) Calm... down.
Okay, I’1l leave you be.
Thank you, Mr Hex.
Oracle will give me a shout if anything changes. We’1ll get you through this, Doctor.
Hex?
Yeah?
I’m... sorry.
Not your fault you got infected. We’re going to fight it, though.
You don’t understand. There are things you need to know.
Yeah. Sir William wants your notes.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 78
Notes?
About that cure you were working on? I told him, you wouldn’
have made any notes.
The cure. Yes. I need to work on the cure. (RETREATING INTO MEMORIES, REMEMBERING HEX’S MUM) I will come back for you.
Come back? Are you going somewhere?
(QUIET, SAD) That’s what I told her... That’s what I promised...
The Doctor’s temperature is rising. Forty-two point seven degrees.
. but time has a habit of running away from one ....
Forty-two point four degrees.
Extreme concentration, yeah?
Tommy ...
What?
(CORRECTING SELF) Hex. Of course. Hex. Must... concentrate.
Thirty-nine point seven degrees.
That’s it. Nice and calm. (ASIDE) Oracle?
FX: DOOR CLUNKS OPEN. HEX WALKS THROUGH
Nice .. and calm.
t
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 79
SCENE 45: INT. CRICHTON BUILDING — CORRIDOR
FX: DOOR CLUNKS SHUT
Isolation cell sealed.
Thanks, [Oracle —]
Good morning, Mr Schofield.
(STARTLED) Whoah! Oh, man, you didn’t half give us a fright —
I apologise. “Man.”
Sir William, yeah. Look, the Doctor needs rest, I’d sooner you didn’t —
I didn’t come to see the Doctor. I came to see you.
Right, yeah. What about?
We will shortly be taking delivery of some... livestock. I need you to check the containment bays. Make sure that they’re ready.
Ready for what?
Oracle can answer any questions you may have. Thank you, Mr Schofield.
Okay. I'll, er — get to it. (EXITS)
(SOTTO, AS HEX RETREATS) Little Tommy. Heh. (BEAT) Oracle, open the isolation cell door.
Confirmed.
FX: DOOR CLUNKS OPEN
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 80
SCENE 46: EXT. STREET — PENGE
FX: TRACKER
(BRISK WALK) This way, multiple contacts.
(BRISK WALK) Contaminants. Stay alert.
(BRISK WALK) Yeah, and we’re heading straight for them. Why the bug—-hunt?
(BRISK WALK) Just following orders.
BRISK WALK) I’m not stupid. (STOPPING
(STOPPED — DITTO JARROD) What is it now?
We land right on top of a nest, carrying two whopping containment units. We’re bringing them in, aren’t we?
Sir William wants live subjects.
For what?
I didn’t ask.
Why take them back to the Crichton Building? It’s the last place in London that’s secure.
It was. Until the Doctor got himself infected.
He’s a special case.
Don’t we know it...
FX: TRACKER BLEEPING CRAZILY
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 81
Ma'am, we’re right on top of them.
Power up. (FX: ALL THREE POWER UP PULSE RIFLES) This could get sticky.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 82
SCENE 47: INT. ISOLATION CELL
Temperature now thirty-four degrees.
Doctor. I have to say, I’m impressed.
(CONCENTRATING THROUGHOUT) Nimrod. I am... rather busy, you know...

Keeping your temperature down by sheer force of will. Phenomenal. What’s more, Oracle’s bio-scan indicates your body is trying to repair the damage the infestation is causing, even as the parasites surge through your system.
Yes. I need to concentrate.
Of course, as soon as I found out you were infected, I should have had you neutralised. Or, at the very least, ejected from this building.
I appreciate the special treatment.
But you are special, Doctor. Vital, in fact.
Why don’t I like the sound of that?
Oracle has been performing brain scans for the last couple of hours. The third lobe has slowed to the point of vegetation but here — your equivalent of the epiphysis cerebri...
The third eye.
The source of psychic activity. Ignoring the fact that yours is twice the size of a human’s, its activity has increased exponentially over the last sixty minutes.
Has it.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 83
You’re talking to them, aren’t you? You’re communicating with the Contaminants.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 84
SCENE 48: EXT. STREET — PENGE
FX: 3 x PULSE RIFLES FIRING. CONTAMINANTS SCREAMING
This is crazy!
Keep firing!
FX: CONTAMINANT CHITTERS UP CLOSE
Ace, look out!
FX: PULSE RIFLE FIRES, CONTAMINANT SHRIEKS
Thanks.
Reckon they’ve got the message. They’re falling back.
Yeah, but how long for?
Jarrod, get Whiston’s lot down here with tazers. We’re going to have to herd them through to the containment units.
Roger that!
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 85
SCENE 49: INT. CONTAINMENT BAYS
(FX: HEX’S VOICE ECHOES IN THE VAST CHAMBER. LOCKS SLIDE SHUT, ELECTRONIC HUM OF POWER)
These bays look pretty secure to me, Oracle. Doesn’t take a genius to work out what’s going in them, though.
That information is classified.
Yeah, who am I to question orders?
You are Thomas Hector Schofield.

You’re dead funny, you are. Answer me this, then — why’s Sir William sent me down here? Any idiot could have done this. (BEAT; TO SELF) Any idiot, yeah. He wanted me out of the way, didn’t he? (TO ORACLE) Open the doors, Oracle. I’m going back to the Doctor. (NO RESPONSE) Doors!
I am not authorised to allow you access into the main building at the present time.
What’s his game, your Sir William?
I do not understand the question.
No, I don’t suppose you do. (TO SELF) Idiot!
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 86
SCENE 50: INT. ISOLATION CELL
. But this is a wonderful opportunity, Doctor! A conduit to communicate with the alien hive mind. To observe. To study —
To butcher.
To win. (BEAT) Why are they doing this? Doctor?
Temperature: fifty-four point six degrees.
Answer me!
Every second the strength of the hive mind increases. Even now... it calls to me... (GASPS)
What does it say?
I — I can’t help you. Not this time.
You seem to think you have a choice!
(FX: THERE IS A SCUFFLE AS NIMROD PICKS THE DOCTOR UP AND SLAMS HIM AGAINST THE WALL)
(CHOKED) Nimrod... please...
It wasn’t easy, Doctor, rebuilding the Department piece by piece after the devastation you caused.
(CHOKED) Devastation?

I was disgraced. We were a joke, enemies in every corner. Whitehall. The Hague. Even your friends at UNIT. But I raised Department C4 from the ashes of the Forge. I brought us out of the shadows, stepped into the glare of public life. Asking for help from the man who so nearly destroyed my life’s work... sickens me!
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 87
Warning: temperature sixty-seven degrees.
(CHOKED) Nimrod-!!!
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 88
