DOCTOR: (THE HIVE MIND ASSERTING ITSELF) Your mam? Yes. Hex. The Doctor knew your mam.
HEX: What are you talking like that for? This isn’t a game! (BEAT) Hang on, does Ace know? I bet you’ve had a good laugh about it, you and Ace!
DOCTOR: The Doctor is... losing control...
HEX: Is that why you came to St Garts, all those years ago? Were you looking for me?
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 108
DOCTOR: No. The Doctor — (HUGE EFFORT, REASSERTING CONTROL) .. I was looking for Cybermen. Meeting you was.. an accident. A happy accident.
HEX: A car crash, more like.
DOCTOR: What... what else has Nimrod told you?
HEX: Not a lot, just that she worked for him.
DOCTOR: And did he tell you how she died?
HEX: No. He... just said you were involved.
DOCTOR: But did he tell you what she was?
HEX: Yeah, an agent. The best, he said. The daughter he never had.
DOCTOR: (SUDDENLY ANGRY) The daughter he... The daughter he never... (HE CRIES OUT IN AGONY)
HEX: Oh, pack it in, will you?!?
DOCTOR: Hex. You have to help me.
HEX: Me? Help you? Right.
DOCTOR: Please. I need to get back to the TARDIS. Once I’m there, I can.. stabilise myself. Find.. some kind of cure, perhaps —
HEX: Oh, you are unbelievable, you are.
DOCTOR: (SUDDENLY REALISING) A cure... (BEAT) A cure. That’s right, Hex. A cure. Cassie’s cure. Of course!
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 109
HEX: No, you’re just messing with my head. Playing your games. Sir William was right!
DOCTOR: Hex, I promise I will explain. But not here. It’s not safe.
HEX: Not safe for you, you mean.
DOCTOR: Not safe for anyone. Nimrod is using your mother... using her to drive a wedge between us. In order to break me, he’s broken your heart.
HEX: Oh, please. Spare me!
DOCTOR: I was a fool to think this would work. I’1l find a way of stopping this plague, but not here. I need to be in the TARDIS.
HEX: What about Ace?
DOCTOR: Ace can look after herself.
HEX: And I can’t, I suppose?
DOCTOR: Please, Hex. I need you to look after me.
HEX: I can’t believe I’m still listening to you, let alone — (BEAT) Oracle? Let us out. —
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 110
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 66: INT. ARCHIVE
HEX: (D, VIA SCREEN) .. Oracle!
NIMROD: Oracle, allow the Doctor and Mr Schofield to leave the building.
ORACLE: (D) Complying.
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 111
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 67: INT. CORRIDOR
ACE: Hex! Hex!!!
ARISTEDES: (RUNNING UP BEHIND) Ace, stop. We need to talk.
ACE: (STOPPING) I’m done with talking to you. I need to talk to Hex.
ARISTEDES: You're good, Ace. If it weren’t for him — if it weren’t for the Doctor...
ACE: (CALLING OUT) Hex!!!
ARISTEDES: . if he wasn’t there in your head, twisting your priorities, changing your values...
ACE: Shut up, Lysandra!
ARISTEDES: .. you could do good here. With us. Facing down anything. Protecting your own.
ACE: You want me to join you-?
ARISTEDES: If the B-A-N suit fits... why not?
ACE: Oh, I can’t be dealing with this right now. (ALOUD) Oracle, where’s Hex?
ORACLE: Thomas Hector Schofield has left the building.
ACE: Where’s he gone?
ORACLE: Destination unknown.
ACE: Then I want to see the Doctor.
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 112
ORACLE: The Doctor has left the building.
ARISTEDES: He’s what?!?
NIMROD: (D, OVER COMMS) Director to Captain Aristedes. I need you at the eastern exit. Now!
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 68: INT. SUV (IN MOTION)
DOCTOR: (WEAK) Please... Hex... hurry.
HEX: (DRIVING) I’m going as fast as I can!
HEX: So where did you meet her then? Me Mam?
DOCTOR: Now is not the time.
HEX: You want me to carry on helping, you carry on talking.
DOCTOR: She was working as a waitress...
HEX: In a cocktail bar?
DOCTOR: In a casino.
HEX: A casino? What’s that got to do with the Forge?
DOCTOR: Hex, I need to concentrate. (GASPS IN PAIN)
HEX: OK, OK, we’re nearly there. —
HEX: 113
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 114
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 69: INT. CRICHTON BUILDING — EASTERN EXIT
ARISTEDES: What’s going on, Sir?
NIMROD: Schofield and the Doctor have gone for a little spin in one of the SUVs.
ACE: Well, where are they going?
NIMROD: Back to St Gart’s, I would presume.
ACE: No, not St Gart’s. The TARDIS!
ARISTEDES: He’s trying to escape?
NIMROD: No, but I can’t guarantee they’1ll be coming back. I gave the Doctor enough rope, now I need to make sure he doesn’t hang himself. You’re with me, Aristedes.
ARISTEDES: Sir?
NIMROD: It’s been a while since I’ve been on a field mission. (THEY TURN TO LEAVE, BUT —)
ACE: Hold up. I’m coming with you.
ARISTEDES: (DID ACE MEAN-?) With us?
ACE: Yeah. With you.
NIMROD: (AMUSED) As you wish, Miss McShane.
ARISTEDES: Come on.
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 115
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 70: INT. TARDIS
HEX: (HELPING DOCTOR IN) ‘kay. Here we are.
DOCTOR: (A BIT BREATHLESS) Thank you, Hex. The doors, if you would-?
HEX: Sure. (FX: DOOR CONTROL; DOORS CLOSE) Can the TARDIS help you hold back the transformation?
DOCTOR: A little, but.. all the time, I can feel myself weakening...
HEX: Better get on with it then. Cure?
DOCTOR: Ah, yes. The cure. Filing cabinets, next to the library.
HEX: (WALKING TO CABINETS — GOING OFF-MIC) What about them?
DOCTOR: Look under T.
HEX: (OFF) T?
DOCTOR: T for ‘Twilight’. Just do it.
HEX: (OFF) Okay...
DOCTOR: There’1ll be a phial in there. Bring it over to me.
HEX: (OFF) (FX: ROOTING AROUND) A phial. Right. — This it?
DOCTOR: Bring it here.
HEX: (APPROACHING FROM OFF) What is it? Some kind of drug?
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 116
DOCTOR: Yes. I made it for your mother.
HEX: What — she was sick?
DOCTOR: In a way. She was given a.. condition. The phial, please —
HEX: Just a minute. What d’you mean, ‘given’? Not by Sir William?
DOCTOR: Not directly.
HEX: And, what — you were trying to cure her?
DOCTOR: I tried. But I failed.
HEX: And that’s why she died?
DOCTOR: No. Nimrod killed her. Shot her down where she stood because she was trying to help me.
HEX: No. No. Sir William said...
DOCTOR: He lied, Hex. There was just enough truth in there to make you believe him.
HEX: The cure. What was it for?
DOCTOR: (ANGRY, FRUSTRATED) We don’t have time for this!
HEX: (ANGRIER, EVEN MORE FRUSTRATED) What was it for?!?
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 117
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 71: EXT. ROAD BESIDE TARDIS
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: THE SUV PULLS UP. DOORS OPEN. ACE, ARISTEDES & NIMROD JUMP OUT)
NIMROD: My, my — whatever has he done to his TARDIS? Why is it white?
ACE: Now’s not the time. Come on. —
ARISTEDES: (FX: CLATTER AS SHE PASSES PULSE RIFLE) Ace, here you go.
ACE: A pulse rifle? Thought I was a civilian.
ARISTEDES: Contaminants aren’t choosy. Stay alert.
NIMROD: (WALKING OVER TO TARDIS) Now then, Miss McShane — the key?
ACE: Ah.
ARISTEDES: Well, how are we going to get in?
NIMROD: Problem solved.
HEX: (DISTRAUGHT, SHOUTING BACK TO DOCTOR) [You’re lying! I] It’s all lies!
NIMROD: Mr Schofield.
ACE: Hex!
HEX: Ace? What are you doing with [him-]? (CLOCKING WHAT SHE’S HOLDING) You’ve got a gun!
NIMROD: The Doctor is inside, I take it?
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 118
HEX: Yeah. You’re welcome to him. You two were made for each other.
ACE: What’s happened? Hex-?
HEX: The Doctor just — just told me that —
DOCTOR: (FX: STEPPING OUT OF TARDIS, SLIGHTLY OFF) I told him the truth. That his mother was a vampire. (FX: CLOSES TARDIS DOOR)
ACE: But that’s crazy.
HEX: Tell him that!
ACE: Ignore him. He’s totally lost it.
DOCTOR: (APPROACHING) Maybe. But nonetheless, I am telling the truth. The phial, please, Hex.
NIMROD: Ah. The Doctor’s famous Twilight cure.
HEX: You want it too?
NIMROD: Ask yourself, Mr Schofield — who do you trust?
HEX: I don’t trust neither of you! (BEAT) In fact — why don’t you just fight it out amongst yourselves?
DOCTOR: (REALISING THAT HEX IS ABOUT TO TOSS PHIAL IN THE AIR) No, Hex!
HEX: Catch. (EFFORT, TOSSES PHIAL UP)
NIMROD: Out of the way-!
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 119
DOCTOR WHO: (CATCHES PHIAL, EFFORT) (EXHALES) Thank you, Mr Schofield.
DOCTOR: Get away from him, Nimrod.
HEX: That’s what all this was about, wasn’t it? Getting hold of that phial.
NIMROD: In a word — yes. But at least I spared you the facts of your mother’s true nature.
HEX: Come off it. Vampires are just stories!
NIMROD: Oh, we’re real enough.
HEX: You what?
ARISTEDES: Sir, this isn’t helping.
ACE: But it’s daylight.
NIMROD: I expected more of you, Miss McShane. Will you be returning with us to the Crichton Building? Or must I order Captain Aristedes to shoot you where you stand?
ARISTEDES: W-what?
NIMROD: Well, my hands are full. (TO ACE) Lower your weapon, Miss McShane.
ACE: Lysandra-?
NIMROD: Oh, just kill her, Aristedes!
ARISTEDES: (HEFTING RIFLE) Yes. Sir —
ACE: (TO ARISTEDES) Just orders, right?
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 120
ARISTEDES: Sorry, Ace. Just orders — (GRABBED BY HEX) Ah!
HEX: (WRESTLING RIFLE OFF ARISTEDES) I’1ll take that —
NIMROD: Really, Aristedes. Bested by a mere boy. There was a day you would have snapped him in two. You must be getting old.
DOCTOR: Hex, guns aren’t the answer.
ACE: Yeah, Hex. Put it down.
HEX: So it’s OK for you to play soldier, but not me.
ACE: You’ve never fired a gun in your life.
HEX: You hadn’t either, before you met him. It’s the Doctor, isn’t it? He changes us. Makes us what he needs us to be. Well, right now this is who I need to be.
NIMROD: What exactly is it you want, Mr Schofield?
HEX: Is it true? You killed my Mam?
NIMROD: Well, she was a traitor. (LAUGHING) Oh, poor little Tommy, the agony on your face. Are you really going to shoot me?
DOCTOR: Hex.. listen to me. This isn’t the way. If you do this, then Nimrod has corrupted you just like he tried to corrupt your mother. But she fought him. She was strong. So are you.
HEX: Save it, Doctor. It’s too late!
DOCTOR: (STEPPING IN FRONT OF NIMROD) It’s never too late.
HEX: What are you doing? Get out of my way!
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 121
ACE: Cool it, Hex!
HEX: You know what, Ace? I can’t believe I used to like you. (TO DOCTOR) I’m warning you, Doctor — stand aside!
HEX: (FX: UNDER THE ABOVE LINE, A GROUP OF CONTAMINANTS ARE APPROACHING, CHITTERING)
NIMROD: This is a fascinating exchange, but you might want to hurry it
NIMROD: up. We’re not alone.
DOCTOR: Contaminants.
ARISTEDES: That’s all we need! Ace, give me your gun!
HEX: I’m not mucking about, Doctor. If I have to shoot you to get to him, I will!
ACE: Hex, don’t do this! We can talk!
HEX: No more talking! Out of the way, Doctor!
DOCTOR: Please, Hex, you must listen —
HEX: I said, out of the way!
ACE: Hex, no!
ACE: END OF PART THREE
DOCTOR WHO: PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 122

elements.text: PART FOUR
NO REPRISE
MUSIC: OPENING THEME
SCENE 72: INT. CRICHTON BUILDING — MEDICAL BAY
FX: RHYTHMIC HISSING OF A VENTILATOR. DOOR OPENS
Still here?
Was I supposed to be somewhere else?
It’s been three days. You’ve barely slept.
I’1ll be alright.
No change, then?
No.
Never seen anything like it. No discernible heartbeat. No sign of brain activity. How do you know he’s even alive?
I know.
Ace, get some rest. The Doctor wouldn’t want you [to —]
(ANGRILY) How do you know what the Doctor would want? Bet you’re glad he’s in a coma. Got your revenge now, haven’t you?
Right. Okay. (EXITING) I’1ll be in Central Ops if you need me. —
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 123

Lysandra, I’m [sorry —] (FX: TOO LATE, DOOR SHUTS) Nice one, Ace. (FX: FEW SECONDS OF SILENCE PUNCTUATED BUY THE VENTILATOR) What do I do now, Doctor? Hate seeing you like this, surrounded by tubes and machines. You can’t die just because some idiot shot you. Some idiot like me.
FX: QUICK CUT TO:
SCENE 73: PARTIAL FLASHBACK: EXT. ROAD BESIDE TARDIS
FX: FROM END OF PART THREE:
I said, out of the way!
Hex, no!
FX: A PULSE RIFLE FIRES. THE DOCTOR CRIES OUT...
FX: CONTINUE BY FLASHING FORWARD TO SC. 77:
FX: .. AND CRASHES TO THE GROUND. BEAT
Ace... what have you done?
FX: QUICK CUT BACK TO:
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 124
SCENE 74: INT. CRICHTON BUILDING — MEDICAL BAY
You saw Hex. He could have done anything. I thought if I wounded you, took you out of the equation, then... (BEAT) I really messed up this time, didn’t I?
FX: MONITOR BEEPS A DOUBLE HEARTBEAT. THEN AGAIN
Hang about, was that —
FX: .. AND AGAIN. CONTINUES THROUGH:
Doctor?!?
(FLUTTERING BACK TO LIFE, EXHALING) Messed up, Ace? On the
contrary.
Now. (HARD) Where’s Hex?
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 125
SCENE 75: INT. WHITE RABBIT PUB
(FX: SPLINTER OF WOOD AS HEX FORCES THE DOOR. HE CLOSES IT AS BEST HE CAN, THEN WALKS ACROSS THE BAR, BROKEN GLASS CRUNCHING UNDERFOOT )
Pint please. (BEAT) On the house? Cheers. (FX: SCRAPE OF EMPTY GLASS) What’s that? Yeah, I’m here down the Rabbit all the time. Every Friday with the lads, wouldn’t miss it. Cheers, boys!
(BEAT; TO SELF) Oh, what’s the use? —
THEN, WITH A CRY OF RAGE...
FX: .. HE SMASHES THE GLASS AGAINST THE WALL. BEAT
I really messed up this time, didn’t I? —
FX: A FLOORBOARD CREAKS, OFF
(ALOUD) Someone there?
BEAT
Yeah, I can see youse, hidin’ behind the fruit machine. I’m warning you, I’m not in the mood for games.
(SLIGHTLY OFF) (RAGGED) Schofield. Is that.. Schofield?
Yeah. Sorry, mate, I don’t — [recognise you. ]
You don’t know me. But I know you. I’m Jarrod. Sergeant Jarrod.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 126
SCENE 76: INT. CRICHTON BUILDING — MEDICAL BAY
So you’re not angry with me?

Shooting me in the shoulder was the best thing you could have done. The shock forced me into a coma, enabling my unconscious to get on with the business of purging the infection from my body. So we shan’t be needing these —
FX: HEARTSBEAT MONITOR SHUTS OFF; THEN THE VENTILATOR
You should rest.
No time. I asked you: where is Hex?
I don’t know.
What?!
Sorry. After you went down, it all went mental...
FX: CROSSFADE TO:
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 127
SCENE 77: FLASHBACK: EXT. ROAD BESIDE TARDIS
FX: FROM END OF PART THREE:
Hex, no!
FX: A PULSE RIFLE FIRES. THE DOCTOR CRIES OUT...
FX: .. AND CRASHES TO THE GROUND. BEAT
Ace... what have you done?
FX: CONTAMINANTS SNARL
Stopped you from doing something worse!
(TO NIMROD) Sir — the Contaminants!
Aristedes, see to the Doctor!
I only grazed him, he’1ll be all right. He’ll be all right, I’m telling you!
I think he’s dead.
Don’t be so sure.
Oh, this is all messed up! (FX: HE THROWS THE PULSE RIFLE DOWN) I’ve had it with the lot of youse! (FX: HE RUNS)
Hex, come back! The Contaminants!
FX: SHE MAKES TO FOLLOW, BUT NIMROD GRABS HER
Let him go.
(STRUGGLING) Get off me, Dracula!
Mr Schofield is the master of his own destiny.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 128
If anyone wants the Doctor to live, we need to get him back to base now!
We must leave!
FX: CONTAMINANTS SNARL AND CLOSE IN. CROSSFADE TO:
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 129
SCENE 78: INT. WHITE RABBIT PUB

. and I’ve been out here on my tod for three days. Everything’s a mess. He lied to me, the Doctor. About me mam. About everything. He was so desperate for me to go with him, after the Cybermen. Now I know why. —
GASPS IN PAIN
Sorry, mate. Jabbering on.
The infection.. I don’t know how much longer before...
Try not to think about it, yeah?
They still talk about her, you know. Your mother.
What?
Back at C4. She’s a legend. Sir William’s protégée. There was a rumour that — (STOPS HIMSELF)
(ALERT) A rumour about what?
That... after she died — Sir William kept her remains.
(QUIET) What...?
They say there are caskets in the Archive. Coffins.
EXHALES HEAVILY
Sorry, it’s just a stupid rumour.
(DECISIVE) We’ve got to go back.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 130
You’re joking.
Back to the Crichton Building. The Doctor had a cure. We can get you fixed up. And then...
Then what?
If Mam’s there.. I can give her a proper burial. Put everything right.
We'll never get there. Contaminants are all over the place.
I’ve got to try.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 131
SCENE 79: INT. CORRIDOR
(WALKING BRISKLY) I must talk to Nimrod. That serum is the only chance we have to reverse the mutation. Then we must find Hex. We’ll need transport, too —
(WALKING) I could tap Aristedes for an SUV. Although you’re not her favourite person.
(STOPPING) Why, what have I done?
You tell me? Something about destroying the Forge? Killing all her friends?
What?! I’d never... (TRAILS OFF)
What?
Ace, you have to promise — whatever Captain Aristedes told you, you must never tell me.
Why?
Those events are from their past...
(REALISING) .. but not yours!
I rather think my future is catching up with me.
What are we going to do?
Stick to the plan. (WALKING OFF, CALLING BACK) You find Aristedes. I’1ll find Nimrod!
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 132
SCENE 80: EXT. STREET
FX: HEX AND JARROD SHUFFLING ALONG, HEX HELPING
It’s alright, big fella. I’ve got you.
(WINCES) This is insane.
Yeah, not wrong. (SPOTS SOMETHING) Abandoned car! (FX: HOBBLING UP TO THE CAR) Hey, and the door’s open! Bingo!
Yeah, there’s no key-?
(LETTING GO OF JARROD) Hold on there. (EASING INTO DRIVER’S SEAT) I’ll see if I can’t hotwire it.
FX: HEX BEGINS TO FIDDLE AROUND WITH WIRES
Where’d you learn to do that?
Misspent youth.
(MEANING “TYPICAL SCOUSER”) Figures.
Not mine. Ace’s. (FX: HE CONTINUES TO FIDDLE. PACK OF CONTAMINANTS APPROACHING FROM OFF) Tell you what, though — this isn’t as easy as it looks —
(WARNING) Schofield...
(FX: PAUSES FIDDLING) Oh, great. A whole pack of them! .. Can you run?
No.
Ah well. It’s not like we’d get ten feet anyways.
FX: CONTAMINANTS CLOSING IN...
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 133
SCENE 81: INT. NIMROD’S OFFICE
Director, the Prime Minister wishes to speak to you.
Very well.
FX: PHONE RECEIVER PICKED UP
Prime Minister.
BEAT
Yes, I’m aware the deadline has passed.
BEAT
We have the serum, modified from the Doctor’s original. We have mass synthesised enough in the last 72 hours to adapt for use with the pulse rifles. We are on the verge of...
BEAT
Sir. 24 hours. Please.
BEAT
I am aware of the alternative. One more day and we will have results. You have my word.
FX: HANDSET REPLACED
Oh, Oracle. I do miss the days of hiding in the shadows. We used to be so...
(FROM DOORWAY) .. unaccountable?
Doctor! So you survived.
(FX: STEPPING INTO ROOM) I always do. The serum?
Impressive work.
Even for an alien?
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 134
Doctor, I meant no [disrespect —]
Oh, we both know what we think of one another, Nimrod. The important thing is to make this serum work, for the sake of the human race. (CONCERNED) These, uh, “modifications” of yours —
Eavesdropping is a terrible habit, Doctor. (BEAT) Your ‘cure’ was simply a modification of the virus that created the Twilight vampires in the first place, correct?
There was nothing simple about it.
Oh, I agree. Using your own blood to create a serum that wouldn’t attack the rogue elements of a newly vampirised body, but would isolate the original DNA pattern locked within her cells.
Once found, it would force the body to re-establish the original DNA structure, purging the vampiric mutation.
Bringing about a.. regeneration. I’ve always been intrigued how similar vampire DNA is to that of a Time Lord.
(IGNORING HIM) The same principle can reverse the mutation in the Contaminants. Theoretically.
But soon the theory can be put to the test. The modified serum is now being replicated. Oracle?
Sample serum ready for testing.
There. We can pick up the first batch in your lab.
This ends tonight, Nimrod. Once the humans have been restored, Ace, Hex and I will be leaving.
Surely that is Mr Schofield’s choice? If you can find him, of course.
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 135
FX: ALARM
Now what? Oracle?
FX: ALARM CONTINUES OVER CUT TO:
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 136
SCENE 82: INT. CENTRAL OPS
(FX: A CONTROL ROOM, SEVERAL SCREENS ALL SHOWING CONTAMINANTS HISSING AND SCREAMING, HEARD OVER SPEAKERS )
(INTO COMMS) Matthews! Matthews, report!
(D) They’re pouring in from all directions, Ma’am! I don’t know how we’re going to hold them!
Just hold on, I’1l be down as soon as I [can —] (FX: STATIC) Matthews? (FX: DOOR SWISHES OPEN) Matthews?
(RUSHING IN) Lysandra! .. (FX: DOOR SWISHES SHUT) What’s happening?
Security breach.
What, your captured Contaminants have escaped?
No. Containment is holding. That’s showing the outside of the building. (FX: UP CHITTERING AND HISSING ON SCREENS) Ever seen Dawn of the Dead?
No, but I have seen Zulu.
The Contaminants aren’t breaking out. They’re breaking in!
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 137
SCENE 83: EXT. STREET
FX: CONTAMINANTS HISS CURIOUSLY
What are they waiting for?
Come on! Get it over with!
FX: CONTAMINANTS CHITTER. THEN, AS ONE, TURN AND RUN
They’re going. Schofield-?!?
I don’t get it. They had us, then they just do one.
They’re all... (EFFORT) .. heading the same way.
(REALISATION) Straight for the Crichton Building!
GASPS IN PAIN
You okay?
I’m looking at my future. What do you think?
Good point. Sorry. (REACHING INTO WIRING AGAIN) The only place we’re going to get help is in there, so best we join the party. — (FX: CAR ENGINE SPURTS INTO LIFE) Gottit!
PROJECT: DESTINY by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (FINAL) Page 138
SCENE 84: INT. CENTRAL OPS
(FX: SOUNDS OF BATTLE FROM THE SPEAKERS. PULSE RIFLES FIRED, CONTAMINANTS ATTACKING, SOLDIERS SHOUTING)
(INTO COMMS) Whiston? Are you there? Whiston!!!
Call UNIT, Lysandra. We’re gonna need help!
It’ll take too long. By the time they get here... (DECISIVELY, GETTING OUT OF CHAIR) Aw, that’s it!
You’re not going down there?
Yeah. (FX: CLATTER OF PULSE RIFLE) Fancy some?
BEAT
Go on, then. I’m game. —
FX: DOOR SWISHES OPEN, DOCTOR AND NIMROD STEP THROUGH
I wouldn’t advise that, Ace.
FX: DOOR SWISHES SHUT
Aristedes, report.
